location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident, Bushire, Currently at Tehran, to His Excellency Sir Gore Ouseley, His Majesty's Ambassador Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary at the Court of Persia

mods.abstract: Letter reports on Bruce's visit to Shiraz, where he sought to negotiate adjustments to the accounts of Mahomed Neblee Khan [Muhammad Nabi Khan, former Governor of Bushire], in order to secure his release from confinement by the Persian Government. Includes a list of proposed adjustments to Mahomed Neblee Khan's accounts.
